title: X Factor fans shook as Love Island group perform great original song
text:
The X Factor: Celebrity has launched its first ever live show, and fans were left shook after the Love Island supergroup No Love Lost took to the stage to perform and original song.

Turns out, it was an absolute bop.

Eyal Booker, Samira Mighty, Zara McDermott and Wes Nelson debuted the track – called All Or Nothing – to rapturous applause from the audience both in the studio and at home.

A pure pop dance bop, the track itself was several shades of Ariana Grande through the Eurovision filter.

The X Factor judges gave a warm reception to the performance, with Nicole Scherzinger commenting that the foursome seemed like ‘a whole new group’.

Fans at home certainly agreed too.

‘Loving the Islanders in the X Factor,’ one fan wrote. ‘Think the group have really good chemistry and work well together.’

‘Really liked that song No Love Lost performed,’ another added.

However, there were obviously some detractors to the performance.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Love Island singing group on [The] X Factor reminds me of those dodgy girls who used to love to stand up in assembly and do a B*Witched dance routine,’ read one scathing comment.

Ouch!

Out of the group, however, there seemed to be two members in particular to capture the judges attention.

Hope we’re not heading for a Camila Cabello or Zayn Malik situation already.

‘Wes and Samira, [your] vocals stood out so strong,’ Nicole Scherzinger told them.

Louis Walsh added: ‘Wes, I loved your rap and it’s nice to see you singing with your clothes on!’

Wes and Samira were singled out by the judges (Picture: Rex)

The show has been a hit with viewers, reinventing the tired format by bringing in celebrities without former music careers to sign a new deal with judge Simon Cowell.

The format also saw the audience sat on tables, similar to a jazz lounge layout, instead of the usual auditorium seats.

The Chase star Jenny Ryan also made her way back onto the show after being booted off the show during auditions.

Yes, despite being eliminated, the hopeful returned following an outpour of love for the star and a ‘Justice for Jenny Ryan’ campaign and it seems as though she was supposed to make her comeback, as the 37-yer-old impressed the judges so much she was awarded a safe chair.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Singing the Conchita Wurst hit, Rise Like A Phoenix, the quiz mastermind smashed her vocals and secured herself a place in the next round.

The X Factor: Celebrity airs Saturdays on ITV.

description: The X Factor: Celebrity fans were certainly surprised when the Love Island supergroup No Love Lost took to the stage to perform a great original song
